item.title: Ukraine Resorts to Shaking Down Nightlife Spots for Recruits as Troop Numbers Fall
item.description: Manpower is the decisive factor in a drawn-out war of attrition—with Russia’s population four times the size of Ukraine’s.

item.title: Japan's Voters Punish Leadership of U.S. Security Ally
item.description: Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba now faces a political battle to keep his job and continue on the path set by his predecessor.

item.title: The Middle East Drug Fueling War, Crime and All-Night Parties
item.description: Captagon is bringing in billions for Syria’s Assad regime and Iran-backed militias including Hezbollah—and it’s triggering a health crisis.

item.title: Truck Hits Crowd at Israel Bus Stop as Gaza Cease-Fire Talks Restart
item.description: Police are treating the incident, which took place in a Tel Aviv suburb where the Mossad intelligence agency is based, as a terrorist attack.

item.title: Ruling Party Claims Victory in Former Soviet State Tilting Back Toward Moscow
item.description: The opposition in Georgia vowed to fight the election results, saying they were falsified.

item.title: Israeli Strikes on Iran Expose Gap in Prowess Between Two Arch Foes
item.description: Recent conflict pits Iran and Israel in a direct, long-distance war—and Israel has the upper hand.

item.title: North Korean Soldiers Arrive on Russia's Front Line. How Ready Are They to Fight?
item.description: The first wave appears young and with physiques that don’t scream strapping commando, though leader Kim Jong Un has reasons to hold his elite forces back.

item.title: A Mayor's Beheading Shows Who Runs This Mexican City: The Gangs
item.description: The grisly death in Chilpancingo challenges the new federal government’s pledge to fight organized crime.

item.title: How the U.S. Shaped Israel's Attack on Iran
item.description: The airstrikes that unfolded met Washington’s expectations while dealing Iran a punishing blow.

item.title: How Israel Pulled Off Its Largest-Ever Strike on Its Nemesis Iran
item.description: The attack unfolded in waves, striking missile-manufacturing and surface-to-air missile-defense sites, but steering clear of oil and nuclear facilities that Iran had warned would prompt a retaliation.

item.title: Israel's Strikes on Iran, While Measured, Push Region Deeper Into a Dangerous Era
item.description: Israel’s attack on Iran—the most serious military strike on Iranian soil in decades—was calibrated to avoid prompting an escalatory response, but it also moved the two foes deeper into a direct conflict.

item.title: Israel Strikes Back at Iran, Further Expanding War in the Middle East
item.description: Military targets were hit in a number of areas, including missile manufacturing facilities and air-defense sites.

item.title: Phil Lesh, Bassist Who Brought 'Box of Rain' to the Grateful Dead, Dies at 84
item.description: An untraditional bass player who was enamored of John Coltrane, Lesh gave the band a unique twist on rock ’n’ roll.

item.title: China's Massive Fishing Fleet Overwhelms Locals in 'David and Goliath' Battle
item.description: Off the Peruvian coast, one of the world’s richest fishing grounds is under pressure.

item.title: Ukraine Is Striking Deeper Inside Russia---and Reshaping the War
item.description: Ukrainian officials and some of their Western backers increasingly see the pain of drone and other long-range strikes inside Russia’s borders as a game-changer that could force President Vladimir Putin into negotiating an acceptable peace.

item.title: U.S. Says North Korean Troops Heading to Russia's Kursk Region
item.description: The Biden administration believes that some North Korean troops are on their way to the Kursk region to help Russia fend off Ukrainian forces who mounted an offensive there in August, according to a U.S. official.

item.title: Israel Offered Hamas Safe Passage Out of Gaza for Hostages' Freedom
item.description: The militant group rejected the offer. Truce talks continue this weekend.

item.title: Elon Musk's Secret Conversations With Vladimir Putin
item.description: Regular contacts between world’s richest man and America’s chief antagonist raise security concerns. Topics include geopolitics, business and personal matters.

item.title: Joyce Mack, a 'Founding Mother' of Las Vegas, Dies at 99
item.description: While her husband’s bank built the Strip, she supported arts, civic and education institutions that made a city worth living in for more than a long weekend.

item.title: Alan 'Sky' Magary, an Airline Executive Who Said No to Smoking on Planes, Dies at 82
item.description: Ditching cigarettes thrust him into the center of a public-health debate, but it also allowed him to change the narrative around Northwest Airlines.
